You’ll run into coworkers meandering the snake plant-lined hallway between Studio and George Washington Bar, Gramercy freelancers hanging out for happy hour (or attempting to work) in this same space, and hotel guests tucking in at the restaurants. It’s aiming to be an all-purpose kind of place and nailing it.PRACTICAL STUFF: Rates start at $200, for both traditional (queen, king) and shared (aka bunk bed) rooms.—Elyse InamineAdrian GautEric MedskerWE ALSO LOVEThe Wythe HotelA waterfront stunner worthy of Williamsburg’s destination statusSOS ChefsWhere serious cooks stock up in the East VillageEleven Madison ParkFour-star dining redefined from hit makers Daniel Humm and Will GuidaraExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
